medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At age 18 years, the patient developed motor seizures initially involving the left leg, which then rapidly extended to the whole body, followed by unconsciousness. On admission, left hemiplegia was observed. Following the onset of symptoms, computed tomography scanning revealed a small area of edema at the right cerebral hemisphere, leading to a diagnosis of ischemia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia diagnosed at age 7 months, diabetes mellitus diagnosed at age 2 years, polycystic ovary syndrome diagnosed at age 17 years.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with reduced glucose tolerance and underwent splenectomy at age 19 for thrombocytopenia. Maternal uncle had bilateral deafness and type 1 diabetes from age 18.
